Articles.Content:
I know there is a limit (I believe of 15) to how many posts you can like in one day. I'm not referring to that. I want to know if there is a limit to how many times you can like someone's content. Not the same post obviously, but just their posts in general.

To be specific, I tried liking a post by @Snark this morning and it said I could not give that person rep (but it still liked the post and displayed as such). I have only liked two posts today (and none yesterday if thats what youre thinking), so I know I didn't hit that limit.

Does anyone know why this is? Is there a limit to how many total times you can like a specific person's content? That would seem silly, unless maybe it was temporary or only for a certain period of time.

I'm pretty sure none of my readers have ever run into such a limit  Other than the 25 replikes per day there aren't any other restrictions I know of, except that you can't rep the same post twice, and you may not be able to rep posts in certain subforums. It does appear that you liked a post of Snark's recently:  [KocLobster liked an answer to a question: School bus : a "Level up" mission design]  I wonder if maybe you clicked on it twice accidentally?
Kuzzter has it, you can rep 25 times per 24 hour period, with no restriction on repeat repping the same person. A single post can only be repped once, though.

I don't know what happened then, but thanks for clarifying guys. I was on my phone not my laptop, so maybe I did accidentally try and like the same post twice. Either way, I can't replicate the error anymore.
